definition: to get it straight/to start to understand things properly/enlightenment dawns

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)
unable to understand/can't get the point

sentences.english: As for me, I began to have an inkling.
sentences.chinese: 至於我，我開始有點開竅了。

sentences.english: He's surely a hard nut, nobody likes approaching him.
sentences.chinese: 他真是個腦子不開竅的人，沒人願意靠近他。

sentences.english: How can i enlighten your wooden head .
sentences.chinese: 我怎麼才能讓你這木頭腦袋開竅呢？

sentences.english: Eye, as window of liver , are bright and clear-eyed .
sentences.chinese: 肝開竅於眼功能正常，眼睛明亮，視力清楚。

sentences.english: An agent, such as an analgesic drug, that relieves pain.
sentences.chinese: 敷這種膏藥，不僅芳香開竅，而且理氣止痛。

sentences.english: If we could get the committee to see the light, we would be able to pass the bill.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們能讓委員會腦袋開竅，我們就可以通過法案。

sentences.english: Those hands-on classes can get a lot of these kids turned on.
sentences.chinese: 這些實踐課，能使好多孩子開竅呢。

sentences.english: But maybe it will spark the boy off, it might give him the incentive to shoot more.
sentences.chinese: 但也許這能讓這孩子開竅，這能激勵他多多射門。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the effect of Yishen Kaiqiao instant granule on nervous deafness and tinnitus.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察益腎開竅沖劑治療神經性耳聾耳鳴的療效。

sentences.english: What does Anders discover about the song that "switched him on"?
sentences.chinese: 安德斯對於“讓他開竅”的那首歌有什麼發現？

definition: intention/motive/state of mind/ambition/aspiration/heart 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
(TCM) to build up one's kidney yang/to boost male sex drive
to disperse/to diverge
nocturnal emission/wet dream

(TCM) the four methods of diagnosis, namely 望診|望诊[wang4 zhen3] (observation), 聞診|闻诊[wen2 zhen3] (auscultation and olfaction), 問診|问诊[wen4 zhen3] (interrogation), 切診|切诊[qie4 zhen3] (pulse feeling and palpation)
qi and blood (two basic bodily fluids of Chinese medicine)
slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
nice/pleasant
deaf
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
the way of maintaining good health
adrenal glands
to enrich the blood
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
to reduce swelling/detumescence/(fig.) to streamline (a bloated bureaucracy etc)
expression/manner/vigorous/impressive/lofty/pretentious
